Body.Content:
On July 28, you can participate in three hours of live Q&A with the engineering teams behind the latest Windows deployment, servicing, and management capabilities. The agenda features three hours of Ask Microsoft Anything (AMA) sessions: 
  • 8:00 AM PT - AMA: Windows Autopilot 
  • 9:00 AM PT - AMA: Windows update and driver management 
  • 9:30 AM PT - AMA Microsoft Connected Cache and Delivery Optimization 
  • 10:00 AM PT - AMA: Windows and AI experiences 
 
When will this happen: 
This live event will take place on the Microsoft Tech Community on Monday, July 28 from 8:00 to 11:00 AM PT (3:00 to 6:00 PM UTC). All sessions will be recorded so they can be viewed on demand.  
 
What you need to do to prepare: 
No registration is required for this event. To participate, visit https://aka.ms/TCL/Windows, sign in with your Microsoft account, then select the sessions you are interested in. Add sessions to your calendar or select “Attend” to receive reminders. You can post your questions in advance or during the live event. To post a question, scroll down to the bottom of the session page and select “Comment”. 
 
Additional information: 
Auto-generated captions will be utilized during the live event. Human-generated captions, and a time-coded list of the questions asked and answered on camera, will be added later in the week.

Title: Live Q&A for Windows IT admins - July 28
